result.execSummary:
The defendant Tina M Trelka was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Tina M Trelka in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
10:37 a.m.  Court calls the case. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of:  NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Drengler makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
Pay fine of $100 plus costs including the DNA surcharge.  To be paid within 60 days or set up a payment plan. 
Submit a DNA sample if requested.

ADDRESS INFO for Tina M Trelka
Current: 1911 Oak Street, Wisconsin Rapids, WI 54494 United States  (Effective: 02-17-2016)
Prior: 1017 Franklin St, Stevens Point, WI 54481

3:14 p.m. Defendant Tina M Trelka in court with attorney Atty McFarland for Ryan Drengler. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

Arraignment:
  State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 10:45 am.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a legal valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.
1:23 p.m. Defendant Tina M Trelka in court. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  ADA Constable request sign bond be reinstated.  BTC: Warrant quashed.  $1000

Defendant does not appear.  Attorney Acalia Halverson in court for Ryan Drengler. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
3:11 p.m.  Court calls the case.

Atty Constable makes statements to the Court. 
Atty Halverson makes statements to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:  Bench warrant.  $500 cash alternative.

Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a legal valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
***11-11-15: BOND REINSTATED****

Defendant Tina M Trelka in court with attorney Acalia Halverson. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

State recommends a $1,000 signature bond with conditions as stated.
Atty Halverson does not object.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 9, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Last page to be added to the criminal complaint
